business.headline: Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher today. Here's whyAt 8:14 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,950, suggesting a positive start above Thursday's Nifty50 close of 24,833.6. This indicates that markets may open with gains in early trade.

Stocks to watch on May 30: LIC, Baja Auto, Ola, Nykaa, Mazagaon Dock, IndiGoAs the week nears its end, investors will be looking out for key movements on Friday, May 30, especially as several companies are expected to release their quarterly earnings.
Elf beauty buys Hailey Bieber's Rhode in $1 billion dealElf will acquire Rhode for $600 million in cash and $200 million of newly issued shares of Elf Beauty common stock.

Mumbai's Dharavi to get a Rs 95,790 crore makeover in 7 yearsThe redevelopment is being led by a special purpose vehicle (SPV), Navbharat Mega Developers Private Limited (NMDPL), formed through a joint venture between the Maharashtra government's Slum Rehabilitation Authority (SRA) and the Adani Group's Dharavi Redevelopment Project Private Limited (DRPPL).

Mumbai's record home deal: USV's chairperson picks up duplexes for Rs 639 croreThese sea-facing homes are in the high-end 40-storey Naman Xana building on Worli Sea Face, offering stunning views of the Arabian Sea. The duplexes are spread across four floors – from the 32nd to the 35th, covering a total area of 22,572 sq ft.
Sensex ends 321 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; IndusInd Bank up over 2%The BSE Sensex ended 320.70 points higher at 81,633.02, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 81.15 points higher at 24,833.60.

From PF access to free Aadhaar update: 5 key financial changes in June 2025The deadline to update your Aadhaar details online for free is June 14, 2025. Those who fail to update their identity and address proof documents by this date will incur a fee of Rs 25 for updates through the online portal or Rs 50 at physical Aadhaar centres.

ITR-1 or ITR-2: Know which form suits your 2025-26 tax filingAn informative guide on choosing between ITR-1 and ITR-2 for salaried individuals, highlighting the eligibility criteria and recent updates.

ITR deadline extended for many, but not all. Are you among the exceptions?While most taxpayers have extra time to file their returns, not everyone's in the safe zone. If audit rules apply to you, your deadline hasn't moved. Does your name fall on the exception list? Let's find out here.

New pension rules for PSU employees: Key things to knowUnder the newly notified Central Civil Services (Pension) Amendment Rules, 2025, any PSU employee dismissed or removed after absorption due to misconduct could forfeit their PSU-related benefits and pension entitlements earned during their earlier government service.
Radico Khaitan withdraws brand name of new single-malt whisky after objectionsRadico Khaitan emphasised that the decision was not merely commercial but a mark of respect for public sentiment.
Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares are in focus todayIndusInd Bank shares were trading 0.62% higher at Rs 809.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 9:42 am.

entertainment.headline: 8 films, 30 years: How Mission films became Tom Cruise's greatest adventureActor-producer Tom Cruise took a nostalgic trip down memory lane, sharing throwback photos from eight 'Mission Impossible' films. He called it an 'adventure of a lifetime'.

Sean Diddy's ex-assistant accuses him of sexual assault in court testimonySean "Diddy" Combs faces fresh rape claims in his ongoing sex trafficking trial. Ex-assistant "Mia" and singer Cassie testify to years of abuse and coercion.

Shakira, Jason Aldean Fenway Park concerts cancelled hours before showShakira and Jason Aldean's Fenway Park concerts cancelled hours before showtime due to unforeseen circumstances, sparking fan outrage and refund chaos.

Love Island USA season 7 cast revealedPeacock reveals 10 bold new contestants for Love Island USA Season 7, premiering June 3. Set in Fiji, the series returns with fresh faces, drama, and romance six days a week.

Rakul Preet reacts to buzz around Virat Kohli's like on Avneet Kaur's postActor Rakul Preet Singh has reacted to the ongoing speculation over Indian cricketer Virat Kohli accidentally liking Avneet Kaur's post.

Karan Johar gets trolled by his twins over pouty selfies. WatchKaran Johar was hilariously trolled by his twins, Yash and Roohi, in an Instagram video. From gifting hugs to mocking his pouty selfies, the adorable exchange left fans laughing out loud.

Bharti Singh battles recurring fever, urges fans to improve lifestyle habitComedian Bharti Singh revealed she has been battling recurring fevers and weakness since returning from a work trip to Bangkok. Currently, she is undergoing several medical tests.

Johny Lever reacts to Paresh Rawal's exit from Hera Pheri 3Johny Lever has reacted to Paresh Rawal's sudden exit from 'Hera Pheri 3'. He urged both the actors and the makers of the film to resolve the matter.

Exclusive: No Puri Jagannadh film with Vijay Sethupathi and Tabu, says Radhika ApteRadhika Apte's 'Sister Midnight' is finally releasing in India after a hiatus. She clarifies false rumours about her upcoming projects while revealing plans to direct a Marathi film.

Ajay Devgn and Kajol support 8-hour work shifts for new mothers in film industryAjay Devgn and Kajol support the demand for 8-hour work shifts for new mothers in the film industry, saying the change is being accepted by many. They spoke about it during the trailer launch of their upcoming film 'Maa'.

Ileana D'Cruz radiates pregnancy glow as she flaunts baby bump in new picActor Ileana D'Cruz is expecting her second child with husband Michael Dolan, whom she married in 2023. She shared a sweet 'bump buddies' photo on Instagram, confirming the news.

Exclusive: Ranveer Singh not producing any Shaktimaan seriesRumours suggested that actor Ranveer Singh had acquired the rights to remake 'Shaktimaan' as a series. However, it seems like the rumours were just that - rumours.

Danish Devgn praises AI as friend while Kamal Haasan questions itDanish Devgn embraces AI as a valuable creative tool in filmmaking. Meanwhile, Kamal Haasan expresses concerns about AI's inability to replicate real human emotions.

Where fantasy fights real-life demons: Revisiting A Korean Odyssey after 8 years'A Korean Odyssey', a 2017 show, remains powerful today for its timeless mix of fantasy, emotional depth, and social critique. Not just a love story, it explores loneliness, power, and sacrifice with rich characters and stunning visuals.

Allu Arjun dedicates Gaddar award to fans, credits Sukumar and Pushpa 2 makers'Pushpa' actor Allu Arjun was recently announced as the winner in the Best Actor (Male) category of the inaugural Gaddar Telangana Film Awards. The star actor expressed his gratitude in a post on X.

Exclusive: The Royals actor Udit Arora reacts to show's criticism, Bhumi's trollingActor Udit Arora, who plays Kunal Mehta, Sophia's ex and business partner in 'The Royals', commented on the trolling that Bhumi Pednekar has been facing online for her appearance on the show. In an exclusive interview with India.in, the actor also talked about the series' criticism.

Diljit Dosanjh to begin Border 2 shooting with Sunny Deol in June: ReportDiljit Dosanjh will reportedly begin shooting for 'Border 2' with Sunny Deol from June 10. He will portray the role of war hero Nirmal Jit Singh Sekhon. The film is set for a Republic Day 2026 release.

Let the world see peace: Huma Qureshi meets BSF jawans in J&K, salutes their valourActor Huma Qureshi met BSF jawans in Jammu and Kashmir. She interacted with them and saluted their valour and sacrifices for the country.

Param Sundari teaser: Sidharth-Janhvi star in desi romance bridging North and South'Param Sundari' teaser starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor was released on May 29. The film is slated to hit the theatres on July 25.

general news.headline: Disappointed: Shashi Tharoor on Colombia condemning Pak deaths after Op SindoorOn a five-nation tour, Shashi Tharoor told Colombia there is no parity between terrorists and victims, criticising Bogota's condolence message for Pakistani casualties after India's Operation Sindoor.

US appeals court temporarily reinstates Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffsA federal appeals court on Thursday temporarily reinstated Trump's tariffs after a trade court blocked them, ruling he overreached his authority. The decision puts the lower court's block on hold for now.

Pakistan's terror nexus exposed: Ministers share stage with LeT commandersFrom glorifying Pahalgam attack accused Saifullah Kasuri to Hafiz Saeed's son Talha sharing stage with government ministers, Kasur rally exposes Pakistan's deep state-terror nexus.

Massive glacier collapse buries Swiss village, residents say everything lostThe disintegration of the Birch Glacier sent a torrent of ice, rock, and mud crashing down the mountainside, engulfing homes, infrastructure, and the Lonza River in what officials have described as one of the worst natural disasters in recent Alpine history.
Are you being soft-dumped? Plus, what to do if you areMany people indulge in soft dumping in the hope that the other person will get the 'hint' or that the relationship will dissolve on its own.

News Menu, May 30: PM Modi's UP, Bihar visit; monsoon chaos in Northeast, SouthPM Modi's mega infra push in Bihar and UP, Pakistan's Op Sindoor admission, key judicial and political developments, monsoon chaos, Covid resurgence, RCB's IPL triumph are among hot dishes in India Today's news menu for today.

K Kavitha slams BRS after letter to father leaked, may float new partyMLC K Kavitha, upset over a leaked letter to father and BRS chief K Chandrshekar Rao, has accused party insiders of weakening the party. She also warned against a BJP merger and hinted she may start a new political party.

He'll always be with us: Trump to 'terrific' Elon Musk as he exits his teamUS President Donald Trump praised Elon Musk as "terrific" as the billionaire stepped down from DOGE, ending a controversial tenure marked by federal cuts, legal challenges, and backlash over his political alignments.

Watch: Virat Kohli's gesture to Anushka after RCB reach IPL final goes viralIPL 2025 Qualifier 1, PBKS vs RCB: Virat Kohli, who was a bundle of energy in Mullanpur on Thursday, came up with a sweet gesture, aimed at his wife Anushka Sharma, after RCB reached the IPL final for the first time in nine years.

Amazon Fashion's 'SERVE' Store Offers Convenience, Selection and Value to Gen Z, says Nikhil Sinha, Director, Amazon FashionIndia's first dedicated Gen Z fashion store democratizes style access across the country with 3X customer growth

ISI-trained 'spy' who sent Indian SIM cards to Pakistan arrested in RajasthanThe officials stated that Kasim visited Pakistan twice in the last one year, staying for about 90 days in total, and received espionage training from ISI handlers and senior operatives.

Congress sticking out like a sore thumb is really dumbWhile a rainbow leadership is representing India in over 30 countries and their parties are amplifying their voices, the Congress is busy attacking Shashi Tharoor, its own MP, who is leading a team to the US. Congress leaders are playing petty politics by trying to fact-check Tharoor, and the party is emerging as a sore loser that puts politics ahead of national interest.

8 films, 30 years: How Mission films became Tom Cruise's greatest adventureActor-producer Tom Cruise took a nostalgic trip down memory lane, sharing throwback photos from eight 'Mission Impossible' films. He called it an 'adventure of a lifetime'.

India struck inside Pak's home thrice: PM says Op Sindoor not yet overAddressing a gathering in West Bengal, PM Modi warned that India would continue to extract a "heavy price" from those who sponsor terrorism.

Did Virat Kohli call Musheer Khan waterboy in IPL Qualifier 1? Fans slam RCB starIPL 2025, Qualifier 1: Virat Kohli faced backlash for allegedly calling debutant Musheer Khan a 'waterboy' during IPL 2025 Qualifier 1, sparking criticism over his on-field behaviour. RCB defeated PBKS to storm into the final for the first time in nine years.

Israel agrees to US ceasefire plan, Hamas yet to respondIsrael has accepted a new US proposal for a temporary ceasefire in Gaza, the White House said. Hamas is still reviewing the offer, which includes a 60-day truce, release of hostages, and increased aid to Gaza as part of a broader peace framework.

Eliminator: Captain Shubman faces first big Test against resurgent MIIPL 2025 Eliminator, GT vs MI: Shubman Gill will be facing his first big test as a captain when Gujarat Titans take on Mumbai Indians in the Eliminator of the Indian Premier League 2025. All eyes will be on Gill, and if he will be able to perform in a high-pressure game.

How India must reinvent to become world's second-largest economyFor starters, India will have to grow at 8-9 per cent annually for the next 25 years while remaining socially cohesive and politically stable. The roadmap...

France to ban outdoor smoking from July 1, violators to be fined up to Rs 13,000The new restrictions, set to come into effect on July 1, are part of a broader effort to limit tobacco use in public spaces. The ban will cover a wide range of outdoor locations, such as beaches, public gardens, areas outside schools, and public transportation stops.

Judge to continue blocking Trump's move on Harvard's foreign students enrollmentUS District Judge Allison Burroughs in Boston announced her intention to issue a broad preliminary injunction shortly after the Trump administration revealed it plans to pursue a new, lengthier administrative process to block the students' enrollment.

Swiss glacier collapse: How climate change is weakening glacial glue of the AlpsSwiss glaciologists warn that rising temperatures are destabilising permafrost, which typically holds rocks and glaciers in place.

Supreme Court dismisses Christian Michel's plea over bail address requirementThe Supreme Court upheld a Delhi High Court order requiring accused Christian Michel to provide a local residential address for his bail in the AgustaWestland case

Security drills in Punjab, J&K, Haryana, and Rajasthan rescheduled for May 31The exercise will take place in Gujarat, Punjab, Rajasthan, and Jammu & Kashmir, with the aim of enhancing preparedness and ensuring awareness in regions vulnerable to cross-border threats.

UK man charged with seven offences in Liverpool collision that injured nearly 80Paul Doyle, from the West Derby area of Liverpool, was charged with seven offences including dangerous driving and causing grievous bodily harm with intent.

sports.headline: PBKS have earned the right to play Qualifier 2 in IPL: James HopesIPL 2025, Qualifier 1: Punjab Kings bowling coach James Hopes said that his team had worked hard enough to earn a second shot at the IPL final. On Thursday, Punjab had a disastrous outing, where they lost to RCB by 8 wickets.

How Josh Hazlewood is using IPL 2025 as a platform for WTC final preparationsJosh Hazlewood revealed how he is using the IPL as a platform to prepare for the World Test Championship final against South Africa. The WTC final will take place on June 11 at Lord's.

Eliminator: Captain Shubman faces first big Test against resurgent MIIPL 2025 Eliminator, GT vs MI: Shubman Gill will be facing his first big test as a captain when Gujarat Titans take on Mumbai Indians in the Eliminator of the Indian Premier League 2025. All eyes will be on Gill, and if he will be able to perform in a high-pressure game.

England Lions vs India A, 1st Unofficial Test: Live streaming detailsIndia A are set to kick off their tour of England on Friday, May 30. The 1st unofficial Test match between India A and England Lions is set to be live streamed in India. Here's everything you need to know.

Novak Djokovic plays down injury scare, cruises into third roundNovak Djokovic overcame a painful blister to secure a straight-sets win over Corentin Moutet. This victory marks his record 20th third round appearance at Roland-Garros.

Brook begins captaincy stint in style as England thrash WI by 238 runsEngland smashed West Indies by 238 runs in Harry Brook's first match as full-time captain. The dominant win ends England's seven-match ODI losing streak and sets a positive tone for the series.

India in 4x400m relay: Gold finish for women, men win silverIndia claimed three gold medals at the Asian Athletics Championships with standout performances by Jyothi Yarraji and Avinash Sable. Their wins boost India's position in the continental rankings amid strong competition from China.

Did Virat Kohli call Musheer Khan waterboy in IPL Qualifier 1? Fans slam RCB starIPL 2025, Qualifier 1: Virat Kohli faced backlash for allegedly calling debutant Musheer Khan a 'waterboy' during IPL 2025 Qualifier 1, sparking criticism over his on-field behaviour. RCB defeated PBKS to storm into the final for the first time in nine years.

Wunderkind Joao Fonseca lights up Roland Garros on mum's birthday, gets emotionalJoao Fonseca booked his place in the third round at Roland Garros with a commanding straight-sets victory over local favourite Pierre-Hugues Herbert. The dominant performance brimming with flair and finesse became all the more special as it came on his mother's birthday.

Lost the battle, not the war: Shreyas Iyer on Punjab's hammering vs RCBPunjab Kings suffered a heavy defeat against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the IPL playoffs. Shreyas Iyer's resolve, however, remained firm, despite the heavy blow to the team's confidence.

Rajat Patidar sends message to RCB fans after reaching final: Just one more gameRajat Patidar sent a message to the RCB fans, thanking their fans for their support after reaching the IPL 2025 final by beating PBKS in Qualifier 1. RCB reached the final for the first time in nine years.

India in 4x400m relay: Gold finish for women, men win silverIndia claimed three gold medals at the Asian Athletics Championships with standout performances by Jyothi Yarraji and Avinash Sable. Their wins boost India's position in the continental rankings amid strong competition from China.

Fans slam RCB starIPL 2025, Qualifier 1: Virat Kohli faced backlash for allegedly calling debutant Musheer Khan a 'waterboy' during IPL 2025 Qualifier 1, sparking criticism over his on-field behaviour. RCB defeated PBKS to storm into the final for the first time in nine years.

Wunderkind Joao Fonseca lights up Roland Garros on mum's birthday, gets emotionalJoao Fonseca booked his place in the third round at Roland Garros with a commanding straight-sets victory over local favourite Pierre-Hugues Herbert. The dominant performance brimming with flair and finesse became all the more special as it came on his mother's birthday.

Rajat Patidar sends message to RCB fans after reaching final: Just one more gameRajat Patidar sent a message to the RCB fans, thanking their fans for their support after reaching the IPL 2025 final by beating PBKS in Qualifier 1. RCB reached the final for the first time in nine years.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
